channel.title: Will someone help me with the find color function?
channel.description:
Hey. I'm new to SCAR, but I know java, so it was easy for me to learn I just don't get this part. I've identified "treecolor" as a string, with the color of the tree. How come this won't work? [code]FindColorTolerance(x,y,treecolor,5,5,515,340,30);[/code] I look around scripts and people make them just like that. Heres my error: [code]Line 31: [Error] (31:20): Unknown identifier 'x' in script[/code] I'm pretty sure itll do that with y too, so theres a problem with that. But every example I've seen has the x, y, in there, exactly how it is. Anyone want to help me? -----------
Okay, so I defined the X and Y, and just changed it to findcolor for now: Update: [code]if(findcolor(227,193,treecolor,32,32,454,546)=True)then ClickMouse(227, 193, true);[/code]
Error: [code]Line 31: [Error] (31:14): Variable Expected in script[/code]
I now have SRL, but still, it comes up with the error above.
I posted the previous error because the one I have right now had this error, and I saw in other scripts, people were doing what I showed in my first post, without pre-defining X, or Y.
*Sigh* I kinda miss the { in java, in SCAR its "then", and the } is "end;" or "end." :'(

item.title: Will someone help me with the find color function?
item.dc:creator: @dudeofthed dudeofthed
item.description:
@dudeofthed wrote:

blakeman8192:

Uh… I’m pretty sure that could be considered spam.

To Include SRL. Under the Program Name; part. Put "{.include SRL\SRL.scar} and that will include SRL. You can download the latest SRL patch from http://www.srl-forums.com/ and you should be able to see the download link.

Read full topic
item.source: Will someone help me with the find color function?

item.title: Will someone help me with the find color function?
item.dc:creator: @Hex_Key Hex Key
item.description:
@Hex_Key wrote:

you need to define x as a variable, you dont appear to know java at all lol if your getting basic principles like this wrong.

Also i appears you don have SRL installed, install it now it automaticaly creates all the variables you will everneed and has 100’s of useful functions.

Read full topic

item.title: Will someone help me with the find color function?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Hey. I’m new to SCAR, but I know java, so it was easy for me to learn
I just don’t get this part.
I’ve identified “treecolor” as a string, with the color of the tree.
How come this won’t work?

FindColorTolerance(x,y,treecolor,5,5,515,340,30);

I look around scripts and people make them just like that.
Heres my error:

Line 31: [Error] (31:20): Unknown identifier 'x' in script

I’m pretty sure itll do that with y too, so theres a problem with that. But every example I’ve seen has the x, y, in there, exactly how it is.
Anyone want to help me?

Okay, so I defined the X and Y, and just changed it to findcolor for now:
Update:

if(findcolor(227,193,treecolor,32,32,454,546)=True)then ClickMouse(227, 193, true);

Error:

Line 31: [Error] (31:14): Variable Expected in script

I now have SRL, but still, it comes up with the error above.

I posted the previous error because the one I have right now had this error, and I saw in other scripts, people were doing what I showed in my first post, without pre-defining X, or Y.

Sigh I kinda miss the { in java, in SCAR its “then”, and the } is “end;” or “end.” :’(

Read full topic
item.source: Will someone help me with the find color function?
